intro: Quesnelia distichanta, commonly known as the two-ranked grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive two-ranked arrangement of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its slender stems and narrow leaves are adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Quesnelia distichanta is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental appearance and low maintenance requirements.
